message:
Hello guys, 

I made a web application for downloading Pluralsight course's videos.

The main functionalities are:
1- Downloading videos without depending on other applications(e.g. IDM).
2- Be able to save entire course videos in a folder structured way with order.
3- Display the number of raters of a given course which is not displayed on Pluralsight website.
4- No need for valid subscription for free videos.

Your feedback is highly appreciated. If you think it's illegal, kindly tell me.
story: Ebram Tharwat shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Ebram-Tharwat/CSharp-Pluralsight-Downloader
caption: github.com

data.message: Yes, I believe that this is illegal.
If you already have an account, is it still illegal?

One of my friends told me that he has an account and he used a tool to download the courses automatically, then Pluralsight detected the heavy requests from his side and contacted him. They thought that his account is hacked in the first place.

Ebram nice work by the way, specially regarding fiddler & chrome dev tools inspection :D 
just a note will be sent to you in your inbox
I have tried it and it saved me alot of time.I like the technique you used to get video url.

The reason Pluralsight offline experience sucks is their author royalties system. They pay authors based on how many minutes how many users watch.

That's why even if you have the annual plus subscription that allows offline viewing they limit you to using their apps for download/view. It's a major complain because even their apps suck too.

Abdelrady Fcis Ahmad Alfy 
لو مكانش معاك حساب بفلوس .. مش هتعرف تحمل الكورسات اللى مش ببلاش .. لانك وقتها هتبقى بالنسبه ليهم مستخدم عادى
